title: Rees-Mogg apologizes for comparing doctor to anti-vaxxer
text:
Britain's Leader of the House of Commons Jacob Rees-Mogg | Tolga Akmen/AFP via Getty Images Rees-Mogg apologizes for comparing doctor to anti-vaxxer House of Commons leader said contributor to Brexit impact report was ‘as irresponsible as Dr Wakefield.’

U.K. House of Commons Leader Jacob Rees-Mogg has apologized for comparing Dr. David Nicholl — a neurologist who contributed to the Yellowhammer Brexit impact report for medicine supplies — to the disgraced anti-vaxxer Andrew Wakefield.

Rees-Mogg called Nicholl “as irresponsible as Dr (Andrew) Wakefield," in the House of Commons Thursday, following a clash between the pair on LBC radio earlier in the week. Wakefield authored the debunked study linking the MMR vaccine to autism.

"I apologise to Dr Nicholl for the comparison with Dr Wakefield. I have the utmost respect for all of the country’s hardworking medical professionals and the work they do in caring for the people of this country," Rees-Mogg said in a statement late Thursday evening following backlash.

Nicholl spoke out as a whistleblower in March, when he leaked secret NHS documents detailing concerns about the government’s inability to stockpile certain drugs to BBC's Newsnight. Speaking on Newsnight Thursday evening, he said he was "appalled" by Rees-Mogg's comments.

“This time the attack on me is premeditated and it’s an attempt by government to bully whistleblowers, and it’s not just doctors," he said.

Authors:
description: House of Commons leader said contributor to Brexit impact report was ‘as irresponsible as Dr Wakefield.’
